alert.note: Alert for Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 4:51PM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Shingle Creek At Campbell affecting Osceola County. .Shingle Creek at Campbell continues to rise above Record Flood Stage, reaching 62.93 feet as of 4 pm. Additional rises are possible, with a crest of 63.1 feet currently forecast. This is nearly a foot above the previous Flood of Record (62.33 feet) that occurred during Hurricane Irma. For the Shingle Creek...including Campbell...Major flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 445 AM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Shingle Creek At Campbell. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 62.3 feet, Water enters many homes in Good Samaritan Village. Water approaches Sherwood Forest manufactured homes. Streets in Camelot and Sherwood Forest not navigable by regular vehicles. Property and roads in southern Old Town receiving water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 62.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 PM EDT Thursday was 62.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 63.0 feet late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 60.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (5 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue Shingle Creek Campbell 60.0 62.9 Thu 4 pm 61.4 60.7 MSG MSG MSG &&
